ETHICAL.Definition: relating to the individual principles of right and wrong

MORALLY.Definition: relating to the general principles of right and wrong

BASIS.Definition: the fact or ideas from which something is developed

DISAGREEMENTS.Definition: a situation in which two or more people do not agree

RESORTED TO.Definition: to do something bad because there is no other option

EXTRA-MARITAL AFFAIRS.Definition: sexual relationships with someone you are not married to

DEVOTED.Definition: used a lot of time (to do)

THE DAWN OF TIME.Definition: the start of time, the start of history

TREATY.Definition: a written agreement between two or more countries

TREATIES.Definition: a written agreement between two or more countries

JUSTIFICATION.Definition: a good and acceptable reason for doing something

PREACHES.Definition: talk about how good something is, in order to encourage other people to do it

CHEEK.Definition: the soft part of your face between your mouth and ear

SLAPPED.Definition: hit with the palm of your hand

WRONGED.Definition: if you are wronged, someone does something bad to you

IMPLICITLY.Definition: in a way that is suggested indirectly

EXPLICITLY.Definition: in a way that is suggested directly

REVENGE.Definition: something that is done to punish someone because they have done something to you

RECONCILING.Definition: to find a way to make two or more things be true and acceptable

AVOID.Definition: if you avoid something, you deliberately do not do it

OPEN TO INTERPRETATION.Definition: can be understood in different ways

CRUSADERS.Definition: The Crusaders were Christian soldiers in the 11th-13th centuries who attempted to take Palestine from the Muslims

SOVEREIGN.Definition: having the highest power in a country

LAST RESORT.Definition: if something is a last resort, it is what you do because there are no other options

MORALS.Definition: general standards of right and wrong

CRUELTY.Definition: behaviour that deliberately causes pain and suffering

THEOLOGICAL.Definition: relating to the study of religion

BOWS.Definition: a weapon used for shooting arrows (see next word)

ARROWS.Definition: a long, thin stick with a sharp end and feathers at the other end

BOURGEOISIE.Definition: the rich and educated in society (according to Marxism)

AVOIDED.Definition: if you avoid something, you deliberately do not do it

LENIENT.Definition: not as strong or severe as is required

MORAL.Definition: relating to general ideas of right and wrong

PRACTICALITIES.Definition: the real facts of a situation

GUIDELINES.Definition: information given as advice, not official rules

DIVISIVE.Definition: if something is divisive, it causes disagreement between people

CIRCUMSTANCES.Definition: the conditions that affect a situation
